sentences.english: Prevenient grace, therefore, is a process.
sentences.chinese: 前的宽限期，因此，是一个过程。

sentences.english: Could you give us another month to settle an account?
sentences.chinese: 你能再宽限我一个月结帐吗？

sentences.english: Drivers have ten days' grace to renew their licenses.
sentences.chinese: 驾驶员更换执照有10天的宽限期。

sentences.english: On that occasion he was taken to Val-de-Grace.
sentences.chinese: 在那次会议上他被带到缬沙坦日宽限期。

sentences.english: Professer Lee decided to give Johnson another weeks grace to finish the thesis.
sentences.chinese: 李教授决定再给约翰逊一周的宽限期来完成论文。

sentences.english: Firms usually get a few weeks’ grace to make a payment.
sentences.chinese: 公司通常可以得到几周付款的宽限期。

sentences.english: A 60-day leeway could be offered on this deadline.
sentences.chinese: 这一期限最多可以宽限60天。

sentences.english: Allowance for fresh water for all freeboard other than timber 158mm.
sentences.chinese: 除木材外各干舷的淡水宽限为158毫米。

sentences.english: A: I thought you said there is a grace period.
sentences.chinese: 我以为有一个宽限期的。

sentences.english: We agree to insert a clause giving you a ten-day grace period。
sentences.chinese: 我们同意给你加上一条10天宽限期的条款。

definition: flexible/to accommodate/to stretch or get around regulations/a short-term loan
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to pay in advance/to get payment in advance
to pay in full/to pay all of a bill/to pay off
to pay back in full/to redeem a debt
to offer credit/credit transaction/to buy or sell on account
to give a favor (used of Christian God)
to be generous (idiom)/to be magnanimous/Give me a break!
